none:
Originally ripped by Terminal Escape, posted on September 22, 2014 Description from Terminal Escape:
Belgium's mincecore masters were far from passe when this split dropped, just bare bones hc/grind that might've been called powerviolence had they hailed from Cailfornia - too metal for the punks then, and too raw for the hessians. This is, perhaps, the plight of AGATHOCLES, and these recordings are some of the best I've heard from them. Go ahead and dismiss them based solely on the number of split releases and your preconceived notion of what they deliver...your loss. Ecuador's NOTOKEN are more forceful and more straightforward shred, 19 tracks of lo-fi hc/thrash/grind recorded in 1995. I love this shit.  AGATHOCLES // NOTOKEN
//2.bp.blogspot.com/-oChLdneRHNU/VB-n2DRm8rI/AAAAAAAAKys/8I-_HibvGi4/s1600/agathocles%2Bnotoken%2Bcover.jpg //2.bp.blogspot.com/-SNzx2uz-A4M/VB-p7nWoMHI/AAAAAAAAKy4/9rRymVLRtAo/s1600/agathocles%2Bnotoken%2Bimg.jpg //1.bp.blogspot.com/-Un5Omlyi1I8/VB-qC6IzgmI/AAAAAAAAKzA/CW2Q3nTx7ns/s1600/agathocles%2Bnotoken%2Bimg2.jpg

seo.title: AGATHOCLES // NOTOKEN - Terminal Escape
